column4: hyper: perhaps try chmod 774 [path]  ;  this would make root and group run, read and write while others only may look at it.
hyper: is it owned by root?  you may need to sudo the comand
Hyper: i can't get su to work in ubuntu
only three 7's
chmod 777 -spam-
three sevens didn't work either
yes but i need to execute
and i can't make new files or folders in the directory
that's not really what i was going for. it's a very large directory
is there a reason that the file permissions wouldn't change?
it doesn't give me any errors
yes
777 should make it writable then?
sure
thanks for your help. Do you use an irc client with autonick completion?
type half of my nick with proper caps and push tab
no prob, it makes the line change colors and beep or whatever so that people know you're talking to them:)
thx for the site.. i'll go read
have fun
you need to recursive it again, i think
-R once more
you need the -R because it is a folder, i think.
i tried with -R as well and i just get "not permitted" errors for all files
